qas.question: When was the conecept, Sustainable architecture used?
What novel concept was introduced at the end of the 20th century?
To what should a building be friendly?
What sort of power sources should a building not overuse if the building is to be considered environmentally friendly?
When was the conecept, unsustainable architecture used?
What novel concept was introduced at the end of the 19th century?
To what should a building be not friendly?
What sort of power sources should a building always overuse if the building is to be considered environmentally friendly?

context: In the <a0_0><b4_0>late 20th century<b4_0/><a0_0/> a new concept was added to those included in the compass of both structure and function, the consideration of <a1_0><b5_0>sustainability<b5_0/><a1_0/>, hence sustainable architecture. To satisfy the contemporary ethos a building should be constructed in a manner which is <a2_0>environment<a2_0/>ally friendly in terms of the production of its materials, its impact upon the natural and built <b6_0>environment<b6_0/> of its surrounding area and the demands that it makes upon <a3_0><b7_0>non-sustainable power sources<b7_0/><a3_0/> for heating, cooling, water and waste management and lighting.
